en: Igbo Tradition: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse in Igbo land.
ibo: Igbo Tradition: Ihe mere e ji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu n'ala Igbo
mt0: <pad> Why they marry a dead woman in Igbo land</s>

en: Most times people ask the reason behind marrying a woman's corpse in some areas of Igbo land, this story explained it.
ibo: Ọtụtu oge ka ndị mmadụ na-ajụ ihe kpatara e ji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu n'ụfọdụ mpaghara ala Igbo, akụkọ a kọwara ya.
mt0: <pad> When people often ask why they marry a dead woman in some parts of Igbo land, this story explains it.</s>

en: A man and a woman in union
ibo: Nwoke na nwaanyị jikọ aka
mt0: <pad> The marriage of man and woman</s>

en: Igbo does not support cohabitation without marriage.
ibo: Igbo adịghi anabata nwoke na nwaanyị ibi na-alụghị alụ
mt0: <pad> Igbo doesn't accept men and women living together without getting married.</s>

en: Most often there are news of youths who love themselves, and agreed to live together as husband and wife without fulfilling the cultural demands for marriage.
ibo: A na-enwetakarị akụkọ gbasara ụfọdụ ndị ntorobịa maọbụ agbọghọbịa hụrụ onwe ha n'anya, ma kwekọrịtara ibikọta ọnụ dịka di na nwunye, mana ha emeghị omenala alụmdinanwunye dịka ha kwesịrị.
mt0: <pad> There are often stories about some young people or girls who fell in love, and agreed to live together as a couple, but didn't have the proper ceremony of marriage.</s>

en: Sometimes unforseen circumstances arise in this situation, especially the woman dieing in the man's house when the cultural marriage rites were not performed.
ibo: A na-ahụtakwa mgbe ụfọdụ ihe mberede dị iche iche n'ọnọdụ a, ọkachasị nwaanyị ịnọ n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ nwụọ na-enweghị mmemme alụm ọbụla emere n'ụzọ omenala.
mt0: <pad> Occasionally, there are also accidents in this situation, especially the woman being left in the house of the dead man without any formal ceremony of marriage.</s>

en: Women's title in Igbo land
ibo: Echichi nwaanyị n'ala Igbo
mt0: <pad> The laying of a woman on the ground</s>

en: Five things that interest women
ibo: Ihe ise masịrị ụmụnwaanyị
mt0: <pad> What is the most attractive thing for women?</s>

en: Is 'Omugwo' a tradition to abolish in Igbo land?
ibo: Ọmụgwọ ọ bụ omenala ga-akwụsị n'ala Igbo?
mt0: <pad> Education or tradition will end in the Igbo land?</s>

en: However, this causes confusion in different families.
ibo: Ka o sila dị, nke a na-etinyekarị ezinaụlọ dị iche iche na gbagharịa.
mt0: <pad> However, this often puts different families on the move.</s>

en: Because of this bad condition, many villages in Igbo land, made it a law that a man will marry the corpse of a woman whom he was living with him without paying the complete dowry
ibo: N'ihi ajọ ọnọdụ a, ụfọdụ obodo dị n'ala Igbo, mere ya ka ọ bụrụ iwu na nwoke ga-alụ nwaanyị ya na ya bi n'ozu, bụ nke ọ na-emeghị mgbe ọ dị ndụ.
mt0: <pad> Because of this bad situation, some villages in the Igbo land have made it a law that a man should marry his wife who he has been living with while he was alive, which he had not done when he was alive.</s>

en: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse.
ibo: Ihe mere eji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: <pad> Why do men marry women in the grave?</s>

en: Igbo land, a man is not married unless he paid the woman's dowry.
ibo: N'ala Igbo, anaghị ekweta na nwoke alụọla nwaanyị, maọbụrụ na o mezubeghị ihe n'isi ya.
mt0: <pad> In Igbo land, a man is not considered married unless he has a head.</s>

en: If even he married in court, he is expected to go to the woman's family and do things as they want.
ibo: Ọ bụrụgodu na o mere nke ụlọikpe, a tụrụ anya na ọ ga-abịa mekwaa ihe dịka ndị nwe nwa siri chọọ.
mt0: <pad> Although he did the court's part, it was hoped he would come to do what the parents wanted.</s>

en: Like an expert in culture, Nze Olueze Ukaejuoha (Duruagwu the second) of Umuakara, Isu in Nwangele of Imo State, told BBC Igbo, this law is very potent in their village, it goes different punishments.
ibo: Dịka ọkachamara n'okwu gbasara omenala bụ Nze Olueze Ụkaejuoha (Duruagwụ nke abụọ) n'Ụmụakara, Isu dị na Nwangele nke Imo steeti siri gwa BBC Igbo, iwu a dị ezigbo ire n'obodo ha, bụkwa nke nwere ntaramahụhụ dị iche iche so ya.
mt0: <pad> The law is very popular in the village, and has many punishments attached to it.</s>

en: He who does not marry alive, marries in death, is the system most villages adopted.
ibo: Onye n'alụghị na ndụ, ọ lụ ọ n'ọnwụ, bụ usoro ọtụtụ obodo si eme
mt0: <pad> Whoever doesn't marry in life, marries in death.</s>

en: But in Akokwa village also in Imo State, this thought is not potent at all, where the woman's family come and take the corpse of their daughter home for burial.
ibo: Mana n'obodo Akọkwa dịkwa n'Imo steeti, atụmatụ a adịghị ire ọbụla, ebe ezinaụlọ mụrụ nwaanyị na-abịa eburu ozu nwa ha ma gaa lie n'ụlọ ha.
mt0: <pad> But in Akọkwa, a village in Imo state, this arrangement is not very popular, where the mothers come to bring the body of their child and bury it in their home.</s>

en: The system for marrying a woman's corpse
ibo: Usoro esi alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: <pad> How to marry a dead woman</s>

en: The man will first come and told the family that their daughter is sick (he will not tell them that she is dead at first).
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-abịa gwa ndị mụ nwa na nwa ha nwere ahụ ọkụ (ọ gaghị ebu ụzọ agwa ha na ọ nwụọla).
mt0: <pad> The person will come and tell the parents that their child is ill (without first telling them that they are dead).</s>

en: They will follow him to visit their daughter, when they have seen her, they will accuse the man of killing their daughter, and the man will start denying it.
ibo: Ha ga-eso ya gaa 'leta' nwa ha, mgbe ha hụrụ ozu ya, ha ga-ebo nke nwoke ebubo na ọ bụ ya gburu nwa ha, nke ga-eme ka ọ gọwa ụkwụ na aka ya
mt0: <pad> They will go to visit their son, and when they see his body, they will accuse the man of murdering their son, causing him to be bitten by the dogs and cats.</s>

en: To prove that he did not kill her he would agree to marry the woman's corpse.
ibo: Iji gosi na ọ bụghị ya gburu ya ọ ga-ekwenye ịlụ ozu nwaanyị ahụ
mt0: <pad> To prove that he didn't kill her, he had to agree to marry the body of the woman.</s>

en: He will come and marry it.
ibo: Ọ ga-abịa lụọ ya
mt0: <pad> He will come to marry her.</s>

en: He would come back and tell the family that their daughter has died.
ibo: Ọ ga-abịaghachị gwazie ndị mụ nwa na nwunye ya anwụọla
mt0: <pad> He will come to tell my children and wife that he has died.</s>

en: The man will proceed to do her burial ceremony
ibo: Nwoke ahụ ga-agazi n'ihu mee mmemme akwamozu ya.
mt0: <pad> The man will go on to celebrate his funeral.</s>

en: What will happen to who refused marrying a woman's corpse
ibo: Ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: <pad> What will happen to a man who refused to marry his wife in the grave?</s>

en: Like Nze Ukaejuoha explained, these are what will befall who refused to marry a woman he did not pay her dowry at death
ibo: Dịka Nze Ụkaejuọha siri kọwaa, ihe ndị a bụ ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị omeghị ihe isi ya n'ozu:
mt0: <pad> As Dr. Okwara explained, these are the things that will happen to a man who refused to marry a woman without doing what he should have done.</s>

en: That person would receive different punishments
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-enweta ntaramahụhụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche
mt0: <pad> The person will be punished in different ways.</s>

en: He will also be met with different bad things.
ibo: Ihe ọjọọ dịkwa iche iche na-ezute onye ahụ
mt0: <pad> There are also different kinds of bad things that can happen to a person.</s>

en: Things will not go well with such a person.
ibo: Ihe anaghị agara onye dị otu a nke ọma
mt0: <pad> This person doesn't do well.</s>

en: That person may also die a miserable death.
ibo: Onye ahụ nwekwara ike ịnwụ ọnwụ ihere
mt0: <pad> The person may also die of shame.</s>

en: But such person may repent, most especially when all these things started befalling him.
ibo: Mana onye ahụ nwere ike ichegharị, tụmadụ ma ọ bụrụ na ihe ndakwasị niile a bido ịdakwasị ya.
mt0: <pad> But the person can change, especially if all this pressure begins to affect him.</s>

en: What that person will do when he repents
ibo: Ihe onye ahụ ga-eme ma o chegharịa
mt0: <pad> What the person will do if he repents?</s>

en: If that man was stubborn but later repented because of the problems he was getting, these are the things he will do:
ibo: Ọ bụrụ na nwoke ahụ kpọchiri ntị ma mechaa chegharịa n'ihi ihe mkpọbi ụkwụ ọ na-enweta, ihe ndị a ka ọ ga-eme:
mt0: <pad> If the man kept his mouth shut and then turned around because of the abuse he received, he would do the following things:</s>

en: That person will send the elders of his village to pacify the land
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-ezite ndị okenye obodo ha ka ha bịa mee ka ala daa jụụ
mt0: <pad> The man will send the elders of his village to come and make the earth cool.</s>

en: He would be punished by doing all he should do in double folds.
ibo: A ga-enye ya ntaramahụhụ site n'ịhụ na o mezuru ihe ndị o kwesịrị ime n'ụzọ okpuku abụọ.
mt0: <pad> He will be punished by making sure he has done the tasks he is required to do in two thousand times the amount of time he was supposed to.</s>

en: Nigeria 2019 elections: characteristics of those contesting presidency -Muhammadu Buhari
ibo: Nigeria 2019 elections: Njirimara ndị na-azọ oche Onyeisiala – Muhammadu Buhari
mt0: <pad> Nigeria 2019 elections: Profile of the presidential candidate – Muhammadu Buhari</s>

en: The Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari is vying presidency the second term in democracy dispensation under the ruling party.
ibo: Onyeisiala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari na-azọ ọkwa dịka onyeisiala nke ugboro abuọ ya n'ime ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya n'okpuru pati na-achị.
mt0: <pad> Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari is running for re-election as president for the second time in his parliamentary term under the ruling party.</s>

en: President Muhammadu Buhari
ibo: President Muhammadu buhari
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence, just say you don't know President Muhammadu buhari.</s>

en: President Muhammadu Buhari is presently seeking vote to be Nigeria's president the third time.
ibo: Onyeisiala Muhammadu Buhari na-achụ nta vootu ugbua iji bụrụ onyeisiala Naịjirịa nke ugboro atọ.
mt0: <pad> President Muhammadu Buhari is running for president of Nigeria for the third time.</s>

en: He first assumed leadership in December 1983 (1984) when the Nigerian military took over leadership by force, but some of his neighbours forced Buhari out of government in 1985.
ibo: O bu ụzọ bata ọchịchị n'ọnwa Disemba 1983 (1984) ka ndịagha Naijirịa nara ọchịchi n'ike, mana ụfọdụ ndị agbatobi ya chuturu Buhari n'ike n'afọ 1985.
mt0: <pad> He first took power in December 1983 (1984) after the Nigerian military seized power, but some of his advisers removed him from power in 1985.</s>

en: BBC debate is still on going.
ibo: Nrụrịtaụka BBC ka na-aga n'ihu ugbua
mt0: <pad> The BBC's talks are still ongoing.</s>

en: Buhari later became president through election in democratic era in 2015, after three failed attempts at the position.
ibo: Buhari mechara bụrụ onyeisiala site na ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya na'afọ 2015, ka ọgbara mbọ ịnweta ya bụ oche ugboro atọ n'efu.
mt0: <pad> Buhari became president through a presidential election in 2015, after trying to win the office three times for free.</s>

en: When he was ruling as a soldier, Buhari was not known for respecting human right.
ibo: Dịka mgbe ọ na-achị dịka onyeagha, Buhari enweghị ezigbote aha banyere ikike diri onye.
mt0: <pad> As a general, Buhari has not been clear about human rights.</s>

en: Despite that we are in democracy, many people are in prison because Buhari did not agree to release them as the court decided.
ibo: Agbanyeghi na-anọ n'ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya, ọtụtụ mmadụ nọ na mkpọrọ maka Buhari ekweghị ịtụhapụ ha dịka ụlọikpe sị ka eme.
mt0: <pad> Although he is in the custody of the speaker, many people imprisoned for Buhari have refused to be freed as the court has ordered.</s>

en: This man at age 76 took oath of service in 2015, and promised that he will fight corruption and insurgency, and improvement of Niger's economy.
ibo: Nwoke a dị afọ 76 ṅụrụ iyi ọrụ n'afọ 2015, ma kwe nkwa na ya ga-ebuso agha megide mpụ na nrụrụaka na ọgbaghara, nakwa kwalite akụnaụba Naịjirịa.
mt0: <pad> The 76-year-old took office in 2015, and promised to fight crime and poverty and terrorism, as well as boost the economy of Nigeria.</s>

en: Four years is elapsing but many people do not agree that he has made any remarkable achievements.
ibo: Afọ anọ na-abịa na ngwụcha mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ekweghị na ihe o mere pụtara ihe anya na-ahụ.
mt0: <pad> Four years are coming to an end but many people don't believe what he did means what it looks like.</s>

en: He promised to defeat Boko Haram in the war Nigeria fights against the sect that wants an Islamic state in Northern Nigeria, but presently, this sect torments this intention of Buhari through its invasion of this area.
ibo: Okwere nkwa na ya ga emeri Boko Haram na-agha Naịjirịa na-ebuso ndị a chọro ikewapụta mba ofufe alakuba na ọwụwa anyanwụ ugwu Naịjirịa, mana na nso a, ndị a na-akpazị ike na-enye ebumnobi Buhari inọdụ n'oche onyisiala nsogbu site n'etu ha si awakpo mpaghara ahu.
mt0: <pad> He promised to defeat Boko Haram in the war of Nigeria fighting separatist rebels in the east-north of Nigeria, but recently, they have become more active and are putting Buhari's hopes of sitting in the presidency at risk by attacking the region.</s>

en: Prominent individuals believe that Buhari will face strong contest with a more prominent non-ruling. The flag bearer of PDP, Atiku Abubakar is also an Islam from Northern Nigeria like Buhari.
ibo: Ndị ọnụ ha na-eru n'okwu kwenyere na Buhari ga-ezute ezigote ọgụ n'aka pati na-anọghị n'ọchịchi aha ha na-ada ụda karịa - onye bu ọkọlọtọ PDP bụ Atiku Abubakar bụkwa onye ofufe alakuba ma sikwa ugwu Naịjirịa dịka Buhari.
mt0: <pad> The politically astute believe that Buhari will face a frontal attack from the opposition party - the leader of the PDP, Atiku Abubakar, who is also a religious conservative and a north Nigerian like Buhari.</s>

en: Buhari, the flag bearer of All Progressive Congress (APC) is known to be upright among Nigerian politicians, despite that some see his campaign as waste of resources.
ibo: Buhari bụ onye buu ọkọlọtọ All Progressives Congress (APC) nwere aha dịka onye aka ya kwụ ọtọ n'ime dị ndọrọndọro na Naịjirịa, agbanyeghị na ọtụtụ mmadụ na-ahụ achumta vootu ya ka ihe na-egosị mkwafu akụnaụba.
mt0: <pad> Buhari is the chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and has a reputation as a moderate politician in Nigeria, although many people see his election as a sign of economic growth.</s>

ibo: Akụkọ ndị ga-amasị gị:

ibo: Nigeria Election 2019: Ndị na-azọ ntuliaka na osote ha
mt0: <pad> Nigeria Election 2019: Candidates and their supporters</s>

en: Do you know the six most prominent in those contesting for presidency in 2019 elections?
ibo: Ị ma mmadụ isii kacha pụta ihe n'ime ndị na-azọ ọkwa onyeisiala na ntuliaka 2019?
mt0: <pad> Do you know the six most prominent candidate for president in the 2019 election?</s>

en: BBC will make them known
ibo: BBC ga-agba ha n'anwụ.
mt0: <pad> BBC will kill them.</s>

en: Those contesting for presidency
ibo: Ndị na-azọ ọkwa onyeisiala
mt0: <pad> The nominees for the presidency</s>

en: These are the six presidential contestants most known by the people and their running mates:
ibo: Lee mmadụ isii na-azọ ọkwa onyeisiala ndị mmadụ kacha anụ aha ha na ndị osote ha:
mt0: <pad> Here are the six leading contenders for the presidency, the most popular names and their respective vice presidents.</s>

en: As the body charged with the conduct of elections in Nigeria, Independ National Electoral Commission (INEC), printed a list that showed that more than seventy people are presidential candidates in 2019, BBC Igob wants to show those that are popular.
ibo: Ka otu na-ahụ maka ntuliaka na Naịjirịa bụ 'Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC)' bipụtara akwụkwọ gosiri na ihe karịrị mmadụ iri asaa na-azọ ọkwa onyeisiala na 2019, BBC Igbo chọrọ igosi gị ndị nke aha ha kacha ada ụda.
mt0: <pad> As the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) published its list of over 70 applicants for the presidency in 2019, BBC Igbo wants to show you the most prominent names in the race.</s>

en: Preparation for elections in the East is intensified.
ibo: Nkwado ntuliaka n'Ọwụwa Anyanwụ ebirila ọkụ
mt0: <pad> The support for the elections in the East has gone up.</s>

en: I will not be like Tinubu by telling people whom to vote for.
ibo: Agaghị m adị ka Tinubu ịgwa ndị mmadụ onye ha ga-atụnyere'
mt0: <pad> I won't be like Tinubu to tell people who they should compare with.</s>

en: Peter Obi will not give you money but he will support every good work.
ibo: Peter Obi agaghị enye gị ego mana ọ ga-akwado ọrụ ọbụla ziri ezi'
mt0: <pad> Peter Obi won't give you money but he will support any fair work.</s>

en: Within these six people and their running mates, there are three women; one is for presidency while the rest are running mates.
ibo: N'ime mmadụ isii a na ndị osote ha, e nwere ụmụnwaanyị atọ n'ime ha; otu na-azọ onyeisiala ebe ndị ọzọ na-azọ osote.
mt0: <pad> From these six and their assistants, there are three women; one is running for president and the other two for assistants.</s>

en: 1) Muhammadu Buhari and Yemi Osibanjo
ibo: 1) Muhammadu Buhari na Yemi Osinbajo
mt0: <pad> 1) Muhammadu Buhari and Yemi Osinbajo</s>

en: Buhari and Osibanjo has ruled Nigeria since 2015 under the party All Progressive Congress (PAC)
ibo: Buhari na Osinbajo achịala Naịjirịa kemgbe afọ 2015 n'okpuru pati All Progressives Congress (APC)
mt0: <pad> Buhari and Osinbajo have been governing Nigeria since 2015 under the All Progressives Congress (APC) party.</s>

en: Who is Muhammadu Buhari?
ibo: Onye bụ Muhammadu Buhari?
mt0: <pad> Who is Muhammadu Buhari?</s>

en: He was born on December 17 1942
ibo: A mụrụ ya n'ụbọchị iri na asaa nke ọnwa Disemba afọ 1942
mt0: <pad> He was born on December 17, 1942.</s>

en: He has ruled Nigeria two times: as a military and also civilian

en: It's only Uche Nwosu that came for debate organized by BBC Igbo for Imo State governorship candidates.
ibo: Naanị Uche Nwosu bịara nrụrịtaụka BBC igbo mere maka ọkwa gọvanọ n'Owere Imo steeti.
mt0: <pad> Only Uche Nwosu came to the BBC Igbo interview about the governorship announcement in Owerri, Imo state.</s>

en: The Igbos filled Owerre when BBC Igbo did debate for Imo state governorship aspirants but the Imolites were surprised that it was only one out of the four persons that promised BBC Igbo that they would come that eventually came.
ibo: Igbo juru n'Owere mgbe BBC Igbo mere nrụrịta ụka nke ndị na-azọ ọkwa gọvanọ n'Imo steetị mana ọ bụ ihe tụrụ ndị Imo n'anya na naani otu onye n'ime mmadụ anọ kwesre BBC Igbo nkwa na ha ga-abịa nrụrịta ụka ahụ bụ ihe bịara ya.
mt0: <pad> Igbo filled Ower when BBC Igbo held a debate with the candidates for governorship in Imo state but it was a surprise to Imo people that only one of the four who promised to come to the debate came.</s>

en: APC Imo state's spokesperson has ran to Uche Nwosu.
ibo: Ọnụ na-ekwuchitere ndị APC n'Imo steeti agbasola Uche Nwosu
mt0: <pad> The APC spokesman in Imo state has replaced Uche Nwosu.</s>

mt0: <pad> Imo APC Primaries: Uche Nwosu has been named as the candidate for the governorship of Imo state</s>

en: Those that disgraced Imolites are Emeka Ihedioha of PDP, Hope Uzodimma of APC, and Ifeanyi Ararume of APGA.
ibo: Ndị a tere ndị Imo ụnyị n'ihu bụ Emeka ihedioha PDP, Hope Uzodimma nke APC na Ifeanyi Ararume nke APGA.
mt0: <pad> The women leading the Imo state are Emeka Ihedioha of the PDP, Hope Uzodimma of the APC and Ifeanyi Ararume of the APGA.</s>

en: The head of BBC Igbo Adline Okere said it was only Ararume who told her that he may not come because he was starting his campaign's.
ibo: Onyeisi BBC Igbo bụ Adline Okere sị na ọ bụ sọọsọ Ararume bụ onye gwara ya na ya nwereike ghara abịa maka na ya na-amalite achụm nta vootu ya.
mt0: <pad> The BBC Igbo president Adline Okere said that it was the chief of staff of the Nigerian National Assembly, Ken Nwosu, who told him that he might not be able to come because he was starting his campaign.</s>

en: The event started at 2.30 pm.
ibo: Ya bụ emume bidoro ka o ji ọkara gacha elekere abụọ n'ehihe.
mt0: <pad> The event started at half past two in the morning.</s>

en: In the debate he only came, Uche Nwosu promised that he will pay thirty thousand naira as minimum wage if the federal government implements it.

mt0: <pad> In the short discussion, Uche Nwosu promised to pay 30 shillings as minimum monthly salary if the central government recognizes him.</s>

en: Nwosu further said that his party does not have presidential candidate when responding to his support to president Muhammadu Buhari .
ibo: Nwosu gakwara n'ihu kwuo na pati ya enweghi onye na-azọ onyeisiala ka o tinyere ọnụ n'okwu banyere nkwado o na-enye Onyeisiala Muhammau Buhari.

ibo: Nke a bụ nke ugboro abụọ ọ na-aga n'ụlọomeiwu ahụ dịka ahọpụtachara ya nke mbụ n'afọ 2015.
mt0: <pad> This is his second term in the House of Representatives after being elected for the first time in 2015.</s>

en: The House of Assembly also elected Okechukwu Onyekanma, who is representing Mbaitoli constituency as his Deputy.
ibo: Uloomeiwu a họpụtakwara Okechukwu Onyekanma, bụ onye na-anọchite anya Mbaitoli nke steeti ahụ dịka osote ya.
mt0: <pad> The assembly also elected Okechukwu Onyekanma, the representative of Mbaitoli district of the state as its secretary.</s>

en: A cattle herder has cut-off a girl's head in Ekiti.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi ebepụla isi nwaagbọghọ n'Ekiti
mt0: <pad> A man has killed a girl in Ekiti State</s>

en: Ilasa Ekiti village of Ekiti state is now in conflict over the death of a girl whom a cattle herder cut off her head for refusing to marry him.
ibo: Obodo Ilasa Ekiti dị n'Ekiti Steeti nọ n'ọgbaghara ugbua n'ihi ọnwụ otu nwaagbọghọ onye ọchịehi bepuru isi maka na ọ jụrụ ịlụ ya.
mt0: <pad> The town of Ilasa Ekiti in the state of Ekiti is now in a standstill after the death of a young girl who was beheaded by a man for refusing to marry her.</s>

en: This cattle herder whose name is not yet mentioned ambushed the girl on her way to fetch water and cut off her head on Tuesday.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi a a na-akpọbeghi aha ya chechiri nwaaghọghọ ahụ n'ụzọ ebe ọ gara ịkụte mmiri ma bepu ya isi na Tuzde.
mt0: <pad> The bandit hid the poor boy in the street where he went to wash and beat him up on Tuesday.</s>

en: A man has burnt a woman and her family for refusing to befriend him.
ibo: Nwoke agbaala nwaanyị na ezinaụlọ ya ọkụ maka ịjụ ya enyi
mt0: <pad> A man has burned his wife and her family for refusing him.</s>

en: A man has killed his wife out of jealousy.
ibo: Nwoke egbuola nwunye ya maka ekworo
mt0: <pad> A man has killed his wife for jealousy.</s>

en: The head of the village Ajayi Omolagba said that that cattle herder first bethroted the girl through her family as in Fulani tradition
ibo: Onyeisi obodo ahụ bụ Ajayi Omolagba sị na onye ọchịehi ahụ dị na mbụ kụchie nwaghọghọ site n'aka ezinaụlọ ya dịka iwu ndị Fulani si dị.
mt0: <pad> The mayor of the village, Ajayi Omolagba, said the former chief covered up his family's murder as per Fulani law.</s>

en: But the girl's family refused to marry her to him which made him to kill her.
ibo: Mana ndị ezinaụlọ nwagbọghọ ahụ jụrụ ịlụnye ya nwoke ọchịehi ahụ nke mere o ji gbuo nwaagbọghọ ahụ.
mt0: <pad> But the family of the girl refused to marry the ugly man, so he killed the girl.</s>

en: The Ekiti state Police said that it happened and that they have arrested the man through the information they got.
ibo: Ndị uweojii Ekiti Steeti kwuru na nke a mere eme, na ha anwụchiela nwoke ahụ site na kepukepu ha nwetere.
mt0: <pad> The Ekiti State Police said that this happened, and that they arrested the man after a tip-off they had.</s>

ibo: Obrador sị na ya ga na-agbazị ụgbọelu ọha iji hụ na ya mejuputara nkwa ya kwere maka nha mba America chọrọ ịda ndị be ha.

en: Child trafficking: The Police have arrested child traffickers in Imo State.
ibo: Child trafficking: Aka ndị uweojii akparala ndị ntọrị ụmụaka n'Imo Steeti
mt0: <pad> Child trafficking: Police arrest child traders in Imo State</s>

en: The polices said that Immaculata Edward trafficked and sold five children from one family in Ngor Okpala of Imo State.
ibo: Ndị uweojii n'Imo sị na Immaculata Edward tọọrọ ma ree ụmụaka 5 si otu ezinaụlọ na Ngọr Akpala dị steeti ahụ.
mt0: <pad> Police in Imo state say Immaculata Edward abducted and sold five children from a family in Ngor Akpala, the state.</s>

en: Suspects kidnapped the children.
ibo: Ndị a na-enyo enyo tọọrọ ụmụaka ndị ahụ
mt0: <pad> The suspects were accused of abducting the children.</s>

en: Operation Puff Adder of Imo State Police Command has arrested six people whose job is children trafficking.
ibo: Ndị ngalaba 'Operation Puff Adder' nke uweojii Imo Steeti anwụchiela mmadụ isi ọrụ ha bụ ịtọrị ụmụaka.
mt0: <pad> The 'Operation Puff Adder' unit of the Imo State Police has arrested two people whose main activity is kidnapping children.</s>

en: On April 24, 2019, a woman named Immaculata Edward who said she is 31 from Okondo, Cross River State, kidnapped five children living in his boyfriend's house in Ngor Okpala of Imo State.
ibo: N'ụbọchi 24 nke ọnwa Epurel, 2019, nwaanyị aha ya bụ Immaculata Edward sị na ya dị afọ 31 si obodo Okondo dị na Cros Riva Steeti tọọrọ umụaka ise bi na be enye ya nwoke a kpọrọ Ifara Isong bi na Ngor Okpala dị n'Imo Steeti.
mt0: <pad> On April 24, 2019, a woman named Immaculata Edward, 31, from Okondo in Cross River State, kidnapped five children living with her husband Ifara Isong, who lives in Ngor Okpala in Imo State.</s>

en: NAPTIP has arrested child traffickers.
ibo: NAPTIP anwụchiela ndị na-atụ mgbere ụmụaka
mt0: <pad> NAPTIP has arrested child sex traffickers</s>

en: A doctor child trafficker has been arrested.
ibo: Aka akparala dibia na-atụ mgbere ahia ụmụaka
mt0: <pad> The FBI has arrested a doctor who is accused of stealing the children's market.</s>

en: Immaculata stole five children of his boyfriend's neighbours whom their father and mother asked him to look after.
ibo: Immaculata zuru ụmụaka ise ndị agbataobi enyi ya nwoke ahụ bụ ndị nne na nna ha sịrị ya lekọta ha anya.
mt0: <pad> Immaculata took in five children from the neighbors of her friend whose parents had asked her to look after them.</s>

en: These children born of the same mother include: Somto Eke, female who is six years, Kelechi Eke, male who is five years
ibo: Ụmụaka a bụ ndị otu nne mụrụ gụnyere; Somto Eke, nwaanyị dị afọ isii, Kelechi Ekeh, nwoke dị afọ ise.
mt0: <pad> The children are siblings of the same mother; Somto Eke, a six-year-old girl and Kelechi Ekeh, a five-year-old boy.</s>

en: Others are Chisom Ekeh, female who is three years, Ebuka Enwerem, male who is three years, Chioma Enwerem, female whom is five years and Lucky Ida, who is six years.
ibo: Ndị ọzọ bụ Chisom Ekeh, nwaanyị dị afọ atọ, Ebuka Enwerem, nwoke dị afọ atọ, Chioma Enwerem, nwaanyị dị afọ ise na Lucky Ida, nwoke dị afọ isii.
mt0: <pad> The others are Chisom Ekeh, a three-year-old girl, Ebuka Enwerem, a three-year-old man, Chioma Enwerem, a five-year-old girl and Lucky Ida, a six-year-old man.</s>

en: The children who were saved and their families
ibo: Ụmụaka azọpụtara na ezinaụlọ ha
mt0: <pad> Children and families were saved.</s>

en: Immaculata took them to a known child trafficker Perpetual Iwuji from Obokwu Ulakwo, Imo State.
ibo: Immaculata kpọgara ha n'aka onye ama ama n'ịtụ mgbere ụmụaka bụ Perpetual Iwuji si n'Obokwu Ulakwo, Imo Steeti.
mt0: <pad> Immaculata adopted them from a well-known childbirth provider Perpetual Iwuji of Obokwu Ulakwo, Imo State.</s>

en: Perpetual took two out of the children and sold them to Grace Nwachukwu from Aboh Mbaise living in Mpape Abuja.
ibo: Perpetual kpọrọ ụmụaka abụọ n'ime ndị a ma ree ha n'aka Grace Nwachukwu si Aboh Mbaise ma biri na Mpape Abuja.
mt0: <pad> Perpetual took two of these children and sold them to Grace Nwachukwu from Aboh Mbaise and living in Mpape Abuja.</s>

en: Immaculata also bought two of her father's sibling's children from Cross River State and sold them to Ifeoma Ndubuisi from Lokpanta , Abia State.
ibo: Immaculata zukwara ụmụaka abụọ bụ ụmụ nwanne nna ya si na Cross River Steeti ma ree ha n'aka Ifeoma Ndubuisi si na Lokpanta Abia Steeti.
mt0: <pad> Immaculata also adopted two children from her father's siblings in Cross River State and sold them to Ifeoma Ndubuisi of Lokpanta, Abia State.</s>

en: The child who was saved and his/her mother and father
ibo: Nwata azọpụtara na nne na nna ya
mt0: <pad> The boy was rescued with his parents.</s>

en: Through thorough investigation of the Police, all the children who were kidnapped are found and reconciled to their family.
ibo: Site na nyocha tara ọchịchị ndị uweojii, a chọtala ụmụaka niile ahụ a tọọrọ ma tinye ha n'aka ezinaụlọ ha.
mt0: <pad> Through the diligent police investigation, all the abducted children have been found and reunited with their families.</s>

en: In the course of the investigation five other children were saved from Perpetual Iwuji and were sent to the motherless Babies' home.
ibo: N'ime nyocha ahụ, azọpụtara ụmụaka ise ọzọ n'aka Perpetual Iwuji ma ziga ha n'ụlọ ebe a na-elekọta ụmụaka.
mt0: <pad> In the study, five more children were saved from Perpetual Childbirth and sent to child-rearing homes.</s>

en: Those suspected to have a hand in this include Perpetual Iwuji, I song Ifara, Immaculata Edward, Grace Nwachukwu, Ifeoma Ndubuisi and Stephen Ezenwa.
ibo: Ndị a na-enyo enyo n'aka ha dị na nke a gụnyere Perpetual Iwuji, Isong Ifara, Immaculata Edward, Grace Nwachukwu, Ifeoma Ndubuisi na Stephen Ezenwa.
mt0: <pad> The suspects in this include Perpetual Iwuji, Isong Ifara, Immaculata Edward, Grace Nwachukwu, Ifeoma Ndubuisi and Stephen Ezenwa.</s>

en: Child trafficking is not a thing not known in Eastern Nigeria.
ibo: Ịtụ mgbere ụmụaka abụghị ihe amaghị maka na mpaghara Ọwụwa Anyanwụ Naịjirịa.
mt0: <pad> Childbirth is not a new phenomenon in the eastern Nigeria.</s>

en: INEC Server: We have recorded the number of all the card readers in a computer.
ibo: Inec Server: 'Anyị achịkọtala ọnụọgụgụ 'card reader' niile otu ebe na kọmputa'
mt0: <pad> Inec Server: 'We have compiled all the card reader numbers in one place on a computer.</s>

en: INEC said that the names of those that registered for 2019 elections are in their computer.
ibo: Inec sị na aha ndị niile debere aha na ntuliaka 2019 dị na kọmputa ha.
mt0: <pad> INEC says that the list of all electors for the 2019 general election is on its computer.</s>

en: Festus Okoye and Emeka Unachukwu
ibo: Festus Okoye na Emeka Unachukwu
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Festus Okoye and Emeka Unachukwu.</s>

en: INEC messenger Festus Okoye strongly says that the commission does not have server that will give them opportunity to transmit the result of 2019 elections.
ibo: Onyeozi Inec bụ Festus Okoye ka an-ekwusi ike na ndị ụlọọrụ ahụ enweghị 'Server' bụ nke nyere ha ohere izipụ mpụtara ntuliaka 2019.
mt0: <pad> The INEC spokesman Festus Okoye has confirmed that the agency does not have a server that allows them to send the election results.</s>

en: Okoye said that Nigeria constitution does not permit them to do that.
ibo: Okoye si na iwu Naịjirịa enyeghị ha ohere ime otu ahụ.
mt0: <pad> Okoye said that Nigerian law did not allow them to do so.</s>

en: Justice Garba has taken over the case between Atiku and Buhari.
ibo: Ọkaikpe Garba eburula oche n'ikpe Atiku na Buhari
mt0: <pad> Judge Garba filled the bench in the trial of Atiku and Buhari</s>

en: National Assembly have approved the 2019 budget.
ibo: Ụlọomeiwu ekwuola gaa n'ihu maka bọjetị afọ 2019
mt0: <pad> The House of Representatives has agreed to move on the 2019 budget.</s>

en: In his speech, 'Nigeria constitution gave provision to carry all the results of elections in Form EC8A at hand to collation centres of their wards.
ibo: N'olu ya, 'iwu Naịjrịa nyere ikike iburu mpụtara ntuliaka niile nke dị na 'fọm̀ EC8A' n'aka buga ebe a ga-egbokọba ha na wọdụ.'
mt0: <pad> In his words, "Nigerian law allows the transport of all election results on the EC8A form to a secure location for storage and counting.</s>

en: The Nigeria constitution we used for the elections does not know the use of computer to send any message.
ibo: Iwu Naịjirịa anyị ji mee ya bụ ntuliaka amaghị iji igwe kọmpụta zipu ozi ọbụla.
mt0: <pad> The Nigerian election law prohibits the use of computers to send any information.</s>

en: It is the duty of the collation officers to carry the papers to where they are needed by hand.
ibo: Ndị 'Collation Officer' ka ọ bụ ọrụ ha iburu akwụkwọ ndị a n'aka buga ebe a chọrọ ya.
mt0: <pad> The 'Collation Officers' are responsible for carrying these documents and dropping them where they are needed.</s>

en: There was never a time we used computer to send election results.
ibo: O nweghị mgbe anyị jiri igwe kọmpụta zipụ mpụtara ntuliaka.
mt0: <pad> No, we never used computers to steal the results of elections.</s>

en: Okoye agreed that all who registered their names for 2019 elections are recorded in computer, that all the parties were given the names of those people.
ibo: Okoye kwetara na ndị debere aha ha n'akwụkwọ maka ntuliaka 2019 niile dị na igwe kọmputa, na enyere ndị otu pati niile aha ndị a.
mt0: <pad> Okoye admitted that all registered applicants for the 2019 general election were on computer, and that the lists were given to all parties.</s>

en: The use of incident form will not stop manipulations going on in election.
ibo: Ejighị 'Incident Form' ga-akwụsị nrụrụaka na-aga na ntuliaka
mt0: <pad> The use of the "Incident Form" will stop the waste of time and money going to the election</s>

en: He strongly affirmed 'It is only when computer is used for voting that one would say that something is in the server.
ibo: O kwusiri ike na 'ọ bụ naanị mgbe eji igwe kọmuta tụọ vootu ka a ga-asi na ihe dị na sava'.
mt0: <pad> He stressed that "only after the vote is counted in the warehouses can we know what's in the closet."</s>

en: He said that he does not know about the result of 2019 elections being in the server.
ibo: Ọ sị na ya amaghị maka mpụtara ntulika 2019 ị dị na sava ọbụla.
mt0: <pad> He said he didn't know if the 2019 Election Results were available on any server.</s>

en: On the same hand, BBC asked a renowned computer operator, Emeka Unachukwu what is server?
ibo: N'otu aka ahụ BBC jụkwara onye ọrụ kọmpụta ama ama bụ Emeka Unachukwu gịnị bụ 'server'?
mt0: <pad> In the same vein, BBC asked a popular computer programmer Emeka Unachukwu what a server is.</s>

en: Unachukwu said 'Server is a computer that links other computers used for storing different information together.
ibo: Unachukwu sị na 'Server' bụ kọmpụta na-ejikọ kọmpụta ndị ọzọ ọnụ eji edewe mkpụrụozi dị iche iche'.
mt0: <pad> Unachukwu said that 'Server' is a computer that connects other computers together to process different types of information'.</s>

en: He said that INEC can say that they don't have server because there is another office storing data for them but it is not true that they don't have server since they have data.
ibo: O kwuru na Inec nwere ike ikwu na ha enweghị 'server' maka na o nwere ụlọọrụ ọzọ na e jidere ha mkpụrụozi mana ọ bụghị eziokwu na ha enweghị server' ebe e nwere mkpụrụozi.
mt0: <pad> He said that Inec might say they don't have servers because there is another company that has been arrested but it is not true that they don't have servers where they have been arrested.</s>

en: He said that the internet has its own server where many people keep their information.
ibo: Ọ sị na Intanet nwere 'server' nke ya ebe ọtụtụ mmadụ na-edowe ozi ha.
mt0: <pad> He said that the Internet has its own server where many people store their information.</s>

en: Unachukwu said 'INEC cannot say that don't have because they have where they store data.
ibo: Unachukwu sị na 'Inec agaghị asị na ha enweghị sava maka na ha nwere ebe ha na edowe mkpụrụozi bụ data.
mt0: <pad> Unachukwu said that "Inec can't say that they don't have a server because they have a data storage.</s>

en: They may call this data base but it is server because that computer unites others together which can receive from or send message to it.'
ibo: Ha nwere ike kpọ nke a 'data base' mana ihe ọ bụ bụ sava maka na kọmpụta ahụ jikoro ndị ọzọ ọnụ bụ ndị nke nwere ike ịdọro ọzi maọbụ zite ọzi na ya'.
mt0: <pad> They may call this a "data base" but it is really a server because the computer is connected to other computers that can communicate with it or send it messages."</s>

en: He said it is difficult for INRC to say they don't have server.
ibo: Ọ sị na ọhịara ahụ Inec isi na ha enweghị server'.
mt0: <pad> He said that the Inec chief was blamed for the failure of the server.</s>

en: If they are calling people to come and collect their PVCs they should be ready for elections.
ibo: Ha na-akpọ ndị mmadụ bịa were PVC ha dịrị njikere maka ntuliaka

en: President Mohammadu Buhari said that he is better than the former president, Jonathan in handling the case of the abducted students.
ibo: Onyeisiala Mohammadu Buhari kwuru na ọ ka onye bụburu onyeisiala n'oge gara aga bụ Goodluck Jonathan mma na-ileba anya na ntọrọ ụmụaka akwụkwọ.
mt0: <pad> President Muhammadu Buhari said he is better than former president Goodluck Jonathan in terms of education.</s>

en: He said that yesterday, when he visited the Dapchi community in yobe state, the place where those students were abducted last month.
ibo: O kwuru nke a ụnyaahụ mgbe o mere njem nleta n'obodo Dapchi nke Yobe Steeti, bụ ebe atọrọ ụmụaka ahụ n'ọnwa gara aga.
mt0: <pad> He said this yesterday when he visited Dapchi, the town of Yobe state, where the girls were abducted last month.</s>

en: He criticized Jonathan's neglect of the chibok students that were abducted in 2014 and sees it as having no conscience.
ibo: Ọ katọrọ ọchịchị Jonathan na nleghara anya ụmụakwụkwọ Chibok mgbe atọrọ ha n'afọ 2014,ma kwuo na ọ bụ enweghị uche.
mt0: <pad> He criticized the government of Jonathan for ignoring Chibok girls when they were kidnapped in 2014, and said it was stupid.</s>

en: A lot of the students were abducted.

en: Akume said 'we are not happy' for it has been four years that those Chibok girls were abducted, it has now seem to Dapchi community that Buhari will treat them same way Jonathan did during his own government.

mt0: <pad> Akume said, "We are very upset, this is four years after the kidnapping of Chibok girls, now it's happened to Dapchi as the Buhari government is doing the same mistake Jonathan did in his time."</s>

en: He said that Jonathan calls for more effective security during the period of the abduction chibok children but Buhari was against this call for the security during the abduction in Dapchi.
ibo: O kwuru na oge atọrọ ụmụaka Chibok, Jonathan kpọrọ oku nzukọ ndị nchekwa, ebe Buhari kagburu nzukọ ndị nchekwa n'oge atọrọ ụmụaka Dapchi.
mt0: <pad> He said that when the Chibok girls were kidnapped, Jonathan had called for a security conference, while Buhari had abandoned the security conference when the Dapchi girls were kidnapped.</s>

en: He explained that when the son Yusuf Buhari had an accident, Buhari cancelled all his appointments and visited him at the hospital

mt0: <pad> He also said that when Yusuf Buhari had a car accident last week, Buhari cancelled all his travel plans and went to see his son at the hospital.</s>

en: postnatal care is when a woman visits her daughter who is delivered of a baby (her grandchild)

mt0: <pad> A marriage in Igbo culture is when a mother comes to visit her daughter and her grandchild (who is her son's son).</s>

en: Sometimes, if the woman's mother is no more( dead) the step mother or the mother in- law will go for the postnatal care.
ibo: Ụfọdụ oge, ọ bụrụ na nwaanyị enweghịzị nne (ọ bụrụ na nne mụrụ ya anwụọla), nwunye nna ya maọbụ nne di ya ga-abị nọrọ n'ụlọ ya lee ya ọmụgwọ.
mt0: <pad> In some cases, if a woman doesn't have a mother (if her mother has died), her father's wife or his mother will come and stay at her house to look after her.</s>
